article:
'Edge-blown aerophones' is one of the categories of musical instruments found in
the HornbostelâSachs system of musical instrument classification. In order to
produce sound with these aerophones, the player makes a ribbon-shaped flow of
air with his lips (421.1), or his breath is directed through a duct against an
edge (421.2).

421.1 Flutes without duct â The player himself creates a ribbon-shaped stream of
    air with his lips.

422.11 End-blown flutes â The player blows against the sharp rim at the upper
    open end of a tube.

423.111 Individual end-blown flutes

 423.1.1 Open single end-blown flutes â The lower end of the flute is open.

 423.2.11 Without fingerholes.

 423.3.12 With fingerholes. *Anasazi flute *Danso *Kaval *Ney *Nose flute
       *Palendag *Quena *Shakuhachi *Sring *Suling *Tungso *Washint *Xiao

 423.4.2 Stopped single end-blown flutes â The lower end of the flute is closed.

 423.5.21 Without fingerholes.

 423.6.22 With fingerholes.

424.112 Sets of end-blown flutes or panpipes â Several end-blown flutes of
    different pitch are combined to form a single instrument. *Diple

 424.1.1 Open panpipes.

 424.2.11 Open (raft) panpipes â The pipes are tied together in the form of a
       board, or they are made by drilling tubes *in a board.

 424.3.12 Open bundle (pan-) pipes â The pipes are tied together in a
       round bundle.

 424.4.2 Stopped panpipes *Pan flute **Siku

 424.5.3 Mixed open and stopped panpipes.

425.12 Side-blown flutes â The player blows against the sharp rim of a hole in
    the side of the tube.

426.121 (Single) side-blown flutes.

 426.1.1 Open side-blown flutes.

 426.2.11 Without fingerholes.

 426.3.12 With fingerholes *Bansuri *Chi *Daegeum *Dangjeok *Dizi *Fife *Gakubue
       *Hotchiku *Kagurabue *Junggeum *Komabue *Koudi *Minteki *Nohkan *Piccolo
       *Ryuteki *SÃ¡o *Seiteki *shinobue *Sogeum *Western concert flutes **Alto
       flute **Bass flute **Contra-alto flute **Contrabass flute **Double
       contrabass flute **Hyperbass flute

 426.4.2 Partly stopped side-blown flutes - The lower end of the tube is a
       natural node of the pipe pierced by a small hole.

 426.5.3 Stopped side-blown flutes.

 426.6.31 Without fingerholes.

 426.7.311 With fixed stopped lower end - (Apparently non-existent).

 426.8.312 With adjustable stopped lower end

 426.9.32 With fingerholes.

427.122 Sets of side-blown flutes.

 427.1.1 Sets of open side-blown flutes.

 427.2.2 Sets of stopped side-blown flutes.

428.13 Vessel flutes (without distinct beak) The body of the pipe is not tubular
    but vessel-shaped.

429.2 Flutes with duct or duct flutes - A narrow duct directs the air-stream
    against the sharp edge of a lateral orifice

430.21 Flutes with external duct - The duct is outside the wall of the flute;
    this group includes flutes with the duct chamfered in the wall under a ring-
    like sleeve and other similar arrangements.

431.211 (Single) flutes with external duct.

 431.1.1 Open flutes with external duct.

 431.2.11 Without fingerholes.

 431.3.12 With fingerholes. *Native American flute

 431.4.2 Partly stopped flutes with external duct.

 431.5.3 Stopped flutes with external duct. *Boatswain's call

432.212 Sets of flute with external duct.

433.22 Flutes with internal duct - The duct is inside the tube. This group
    includes flutes with the duct formed by an internal baffle (natural node,
    bock of resin) and an exterior tied-on cover (cane, wood, hide).

434.221 (Single) flutes with internal duct.

 434.1.1 Open flutes with internal duct.

 434.2.11 Without fingerholes.

 434.3.12 With fingerholes. *Atenben *Flageolet *Fujara *Khloy *Khlui *Recorder
       *Tin whistle *Tonette

 434.4.2 Partly stopped flute with internal duct.

 434.5.3 Stopped flutes with internal duct. *whistle

 434.6.31 Without fingerholes.

 434.7.311 With fixed stopped lower end.

 434.8.312 With adjustable stopped lower end. *Slide whistle

 434.9.4 Vessel flutes with duct.

434.10.41 Without fingerholes

434.11.42 With fingerholes *Gemshorn *Ocarina

435.222 Sets of flutes with internal duct.

 435.1.1 Sets of open flutes with internal duct.

 435.2.11 Without fingerholes - Open flue stops of the organ.

 435.3.12 With fingerholes *Double flageolet.

 435.4.2 Sets of partly stopped flutes with internal duct.

 435.5.3 Sets of stopped flutes with internal duct. *Paixiao
categories: Lists of musical instruments by Hornbostel-Sachs number|Edge-blown aerophones
